com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service
Class Request

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.watson.developer_cloud.service.Request

public class Request
extends Object

Convenience class for constructing HTTP/HTTPS requests.
Example: 

 HttpRequestBase request = Request
     .Get("/v1/translate")
     .withQuery("from", "en", "to", "es", "text", "Good Morning")
     .build();

Author:
German Attanasio Ruiz (germanatt@us.ibm.com)

Post

public static Request Post(String url,
                           Object... args)
The POST request method is designed to request that a web server accept the data enclosed in the request message's body for storage. It is often used when uploading a file or submitting a completed web form.

Parameters:
url - the URL
args - the list of arguments to format the URL
Returns:
this

withContent

public Request withContent(com.google.gson.JsonObject json)
Adds a JSON content to the request (used with POST/PUT). This will encapsulate the json into a StringEntity encoded with UTF-8 and use "application/json" as Content-Type

Parameters:
json - the JsonObject json
Returns:
this

withContent

public Request withContent(String content,
                           String contentType)
Adds string content to the request (used with POST/PUT). This will encapsulate the string into a StringEntity encoded with UTF-8

Parameters:
content - the content to POST/PUT
contentType - the HTTP contentType to use.
Returns:
this
